intro: Rhyticalymma patulinerve, commonly known as the slender-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and gelatinous, sticky seeds. The plant derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized structures called haustoria. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia. Its botanical features make it an important component of forest ecosystems, supporting various insect and bird species.
